items.title: Important Information
items.content: We would like to inform you that Dr. Langner will be leaving our practice at the end of the year for personal reasons. He will no longer be available from May onwards. At the same time, we are pleased to announce that Ms. Knoll will be taking over medical care at our practice from May. Ms. Knoll brings extensive experience in general practice and will strengthen our team with great commitment and expertise. Of course, you can continue to make appointments with all doctors at our practice as usual. As always, we are here for you with our entire team.

items.title: Prescriptions Now as e-Prescriptions
items.content:
From January 1, 2024, all medical practices are required to issue prescriptions as e-prescriptions. This means you will no longer receive paper prescriptions. The e-prescription is not stored on your insurance card, but on a specially secured server. Pharmacies can retrieve this prescription with your insurance card and dispense the medication to you.

Please note: Before we can issue you an e-prescription, it is necessary to first have your insurance card read at our practice. Only then can we issue you an e-prescription. Unfortunately, there may be a time delay between issuing the prescription and redeeming it at the pharmacy, so you should plan for the e-prescription to be redeemable at the pharmacy the following day.
